p: This page lists some of the terms and abbreviations often used in Peppol. You can consider this an unofficial Peppol glossary. If you are missing a term drop me a note.

tr.td: A non-profit origanisation under Belgium law. See this page for details (in French).
The technical connector of a software solution that is capable of sending and/or receiving Peppol business documents
Transport protocol specified in RFC 4130. This was the default transport protocol until 2020-01-31.

Transport protocol specified by OASIS. It was used in the eSENS project and adopted by CEF. The Peppol AS4 profile v2 is the mandatory transport protocol in the Peppol eDelivery network since 2020-02-01.
The document type for describing the non-functional aspects of a Peppol participant for listing in the PD.
A Peppol created specification that define how a business document exchange should take place and how the UBL elements are bound to semantical elements.
Business document to be exchanged stating business level validation results (see also MLR). Peppol does not contain a single BLR - it contains an Order Response and an Invoice Response.
OpenPeppol internal community that is supposed to deal with cross-community topics.
An instrument of the EC for funding and informing about e-Delivery, e-Invoicing etc. solutions. See https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/connecting-europe-facility.
One of the two formats identified by the EN to be supported.

The previous Peppol reference implementation now maintained by EC. See https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/cipa-e-delivery. Superseded by CEF - https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery.
Defines how to adopt the EN to local requirements. It implies, that a CIUS is more narrow then the underlying specification. Billing BIS 3 is a CIUS of the EN.
The Peppol internal team that makes decisions. There is one CMB for TICC, PoACC and PrACC.
Basic part of Internet technology that maps domain names to IP addresses for technical routing. Used by SML.
Generic term for all entities directly or indirectly related to them (DG DIGIT etc.).
The successor of TICC within OpenPeppol. See https://peppol.eu/get-involved/join-a-community/
Usually this refers to the EN 16931-1, the European Norm on e-Invoicing.
This defines an event where people are meeting in real (face to face) and not just virtually in telephone conferences.
Legacy Peppol transport protocol for pulling messages. Has been discontinued.
The technical receipt of acknowledgment for AS2 transmissions defined in RFC 3798.
Working title for a work group that should deal with structured response messages
Business document to be exchanged stating technical validation results (see also BLR)
Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards
The organisation responsible for maintaining Peppol standards and running the transport infrastructure. See http://peppol.eu/. See also AISBL.
A central Peppol service that should help in mapping Peppol participant IDs to the participant names and countries.

This is the European project that initiated all this. Started as a European Large Scale Pilot and is now maintained by OpenPeppol AISBL. Since middle of 2019 the abbreviation was officially replaced with "Peppol" as a noun.
Peppol internal team to manage the post-award assets. See https://peppol.eu/get-involved/join-a-community/
This is the technical identifier for the sender and receiver of a document exchange. This is also used in an SMP as a so called "service group".
Peppol internal team to manage the pre-award assets. See https://peppol.eu/get-involved/join-a-community/
A generic XML envelope structure that defines a header and a payload. See also SBDH.
The header part inside the SBD.
Test version of the SML ('K' comes before 'L'). Currently operated by CEF.
Central Peppol service that modifies the DNS. Currently operated by CEF.
Distributed Peppol registry. Used to lookup participant endpoint URLs. See https://github.com/phax/phoss-smp for an Open Source implementation.
A company or entity offering Peppol Services.
Legacy Peppol transport protocol, based on the Webservice stack. Was superseded by AS2.
Special team that takes care of the "Peppol Policy for the use of identifiers" as well as the codelists required for document exchange.
The contract between the Peppol user and the Peppol Authority. Since July 2022 this has been superseded by the "Peppol Agreement Framework".
Peppol internal team to manage the technical assets. See https://peppol.eu/get-involved/join-a-community/. Now called EDEC.
An OASIS standard that defines certain XML based document types used in Peppol and the EN.
